name: Box
notes: Box holds the keys to decrypt your files but doesn't have the same reputation as Dropbox or Microsoft when it comes to snooping on files.

name: Tresorit
notes: More expensive than the rest, but better security.

name: SpiderOakONE
data encrypted at rest: AES-256 in CFB mode and HMAC-SHA256.
notes: Unable to share folders that others can edit. Users must download and reupload to a share room they control.

name: SpiderOak Groups
data encrypted at rest: AES-256 in CFB mode and HMAC-SHA256.
notes: Unable to share folders that others can edit. Users must download and reupload to a share room they control.

name: Sugar Sync Business
notes: Easy to use, can sync any folder on your computer to be a shared, backed up folder

name: OwnCloud
price: Free (price of a server and management)
storage: As much as your server can hold
data encrypted at rest: Encryption quality relies on trustworthy server management
cloud backup: n (hosted up on your server only)
can integrate Microsoft Suite: in beta phase, not available to public
notes: Requires the org host OwnCloud on their own servers

name: BitTorrent Sync
storage: storage limited to space on your device
notes: 16X faster than the cloud and you don't need to worry about trusting a company because all sharing happens from device to device, NOT A CLOUD BASED BACKUP SOLUTION

name: Peerio
storage: 1.2 GB of backed up encrypted storage, storage limited to space on your device
syncing: syncs across the plugin, whereever you install and login
notes: More like email, sharing back and forth edited files.

name: Dropbox Business
notes: Current file sharing application used by SOU. Examples of hacked accounts on Dropbox.
